federal_programs.name: Housing Choice Voucher Program (Section 8)
federal_programs.description: Rental assistance for low-income families, elderly, and disabled individuals to afford decent, safe housing in the private market.
federal_programs.eligibility: Income at or below 50% of area median income (AMI). Extremely low-income families (below 30% AMI) are prioritized.
federal_programs.notes: Waitlists managed by local PHAs. Portable between jurisdictions.

federal_programs.name: Public Housing
federal_programs.description: Government-owned rental housing for low-income families, elderly, and disabled individuals.
federal_programs.eligibility: Income at or below 80% AMI, with priority for extremely low-income families.
federal_programs.notes: Limited units available. Long waitlists common.

federal_programs.name: USDA Rural Rental Assistance
federal_programs.description: Rental assistance for low-income families in rural areas through USDA Rural Development properties.
federal_programs.eligibility: Income limits vary by area. Must live in eligible rural area.
federal_programs.notes: Available only in qualifying rural areas and small towns.

federal_programs.name: Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) Properties
federal_programs.description: Affordable rental housing developed with tax credits. Rent-restricted units for low and moderate-income households.
federal_programs.eligibility: Varies by property. Typically 50% or 60% AMI limits.
federal_programs.notes: Search properties at state housing finance agency websites.

local_examples.name: New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA)
local_examples.description: Largest public housing authority in the US. Administers Section 8 and public housing.
local_examples.notes: Separate waitlists. Check website for lottery openings.

local_examples.name: San Francisco Housing Authority
local_examples.description: PHA serving San Francisco. Administers federal housing programs plus local initiatives.
local_examples.notes: Extremely high demand. Monitor for waitlist openings.

local_examples.name: Cook County Housing Authority
local_examples.description: Serves Cook County suburbs. Partners with Chicago Housing Authority for regional coverage.
local_examples.notes: Covers suburban Cook County. Chicago proper served by CHA.

state_resources.name: California Department of Housing and Community Development
state_resources.description: State housing agency with rental assistance and affordable housing programs.

state_resources.name: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
state_resources.description: State housing agency administering rental assistance and affordable housing development.

state_resources.name: Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs
state_resources.description: State housing agency for Texas with various rental assistance programs.

emergency_assistance.name: Emergency Rental Assistance Programs
emergency_assistance.description: Federal emergency rental assistance for COVID-19 impacted households. Programs vary by state/locality.
emergency_assistance.notes: Check local program availability. Many programs closed or have waitlists.

emergency_assistance.name: Salvation Army Rental Assistance
emergency_assistance.description: Emergency financial assistance including rent help from Salvation Army locations.
emergency_assistance.notes: Available funds and eligibility vary by location.

search_tips: Contact your local Public Housing Authority (PHA) for Section 8 and public housing waitlists
Many waitlists are closed - check periodically for openings
Income limits based on Area Median Income (AMI) for your location
Extremely low-income households (under 30% AMI) receive priority
Some programs have residency, citizenship, or background check requirements
Emergency assistance may be available while waiting for long-term programs
